# shadowColor

**Instance Property**

The color to apply to the bar’s custom or default shadow.

## Declaration

```swift
@NSCopying @MainActor var shadowColor: UIColor? { get set }
```

## Discussion

UIKit uses this property and the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBarAppearance/shadowImage] property to determine the shadow’s appearance. When [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBarAppearance/shadowImage] is `nil`, the bar displays a default shadow tinted according to the value of this property. If this property is `nil` or contains the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIColor/clear] color, the bar displays no shadow.

If [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBarAppearance/shadowImage] contains a template image, the bar uses the image for the shadow and tints it using the value in this property. If this property is `nil` or contains the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIColor/clear] color, the bar displays no shadow. However, if [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBarAppearance/shadowImage] doesn’t contain a template image, the bar displays the image without applying the color in this property.

## Configuring the shadow appearance

- **shadowImage**: The image to use for the bar’s shadow.
